body.p:
War Department,
Washington City,
May 19th, 1864
His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette.
Governor of Kentucky.
Louisville.
Kentucky.
Sir:

I am instructed by the Secretary of War to acknowledge the receipt of your Excellency's communication of the 28th ultimo, asking if any arrangements can be made for the payment, by the United States, of the 68th Regiment Enrolled Militia of Kentucky, called out in April last by Colonel Gallup, Commanding the District of East Kentucky, for the purpose of protecting his depots and lines of communication, when threatened by the rebels; and, in reply, to state, that the Paymaster General has been ordered to pay these troops for the time they were actually in service.

Very Respectfully,
(over)
Your Obedient Servant,
Louis H Pelonze
Ass't. Adj't. Gen'l.

Louis H Pelonza A. A. G. is instructed by Secty War to acknowledge receipt of the Gov's communciation of the 28th ultimo and to state that the PayMaster Genl has been instructed to pay the 68th Regt Ky E. M. for the time they were actually in service.
Letter from War Dept relative to pay of 68' Enrolled Militia
